channel.title: Hyperion - Respect the Revolution
channel.description:
The Problem: As all of you know, the release of Project Insanity has fueled the use of 500+ items on 317s. I hate this, and I'm sure some of you do too. Before Project Insanity, there was Delta. Delta was a poorly written server as is Project Insanity but many use it. Why? It was POPULAR. There was a server around for a couple years before the source was released. Graham released his base so that more players will use it. The thing is, no one is using it. So how do we get people to start using Hyperion?
The Solution: Someone creates a server with a cool name, (Hyperion), hosts it with loads and loads of content. Obtains a strong player base. It fights to the top. It coasts at the top for a year or longer. The server is released with most of the content. Players stop using PI and go for the next best server. It's how it works. PI beat out Delta, Delta beat out All-Star.
[img]http://s4.postimage.org/n7p4odut2/Hyperion_Banner.jpg[/img]
I have decided to create this project thread because I want to create a server that is incredibly popular. During the next few months however, the server will see little to no work done on it. I have football and school. I can do some stuff on the weekends but not a lot. I am expecting to work on this in early November as that is when football ends and I get in a groove with school.
Currently Working on: Packets/Packet Handlers Here's my list. I believe I have most of the necessary packets to start work on skills. I plan on using Graham's HarvestingAction for most, if not all of the skills. Once I get a good handle on the method, I'll be pumping out updates. [code] # Hyperion configuration file
# world loader worldLoader: org.hyperion.rs2.GenericWorldLoader
# login server loginServer: localhost # world password nodePassword: ballsack # world id nodeId: 1
# packet handlers # keep alive packetHandlers[0]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.QuietPacketHandler # region update packetHandlers[3]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.QuietPacketHandler # region loaded packetHandlers[121]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.RegionUpdatePacketHandler packetHandlers[210]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.RegionUpdatePacketHandler # camera rotation packetHandlers[86]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.QuietPacketHandler # mouse click packetHandlers[241]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.QuietPacketHandler # action button packetHandlers[185]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ActionButtonPacketHandler # walking packetHandlers[248]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.WalkingPacketHandler packetHandlers[164]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.WalkingPacketHandler packetHandlers[98]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.WalkingPacketHandler # public chat packetHandlers[4]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ChatPacketHandler # commands packetHandlers[103]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.CommandPacketHandler # wield packetHandlers[41]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.WieldPacketHandler # item option 1 packetHandlers[145]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler # item option 2 packetHandlers[117]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler # item option 3 packetHandlers[43]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler # item option 4 packetHandlers[129]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler # item option 5 packetHandlers[135]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler # drop item option packetHandlers[87]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler # pickup item option packetHandlers[236]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler # consume item option packetHandlers[122]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler # object option 1 packetHandlers[132]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ObjectOptionPacketHandler # object option 2 packetHandlers[252]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ObjectOptionPacketHandler # object option 3 packetHandlers[70]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ObjectOptionPacketHandler # player option 1 packetHandlers[128]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.PlayerOptionPacketHandler # magic on player packetHandlers[249]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.MagicOnPlayerPacketHandler # switch items packetHandlers[214]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.SwitchItemPacketHandler # close interface packetHandlers[130]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.CloseInterfacePacketHandler # enter amount packetHandlers[208]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.EnterAmountPacketHandler # report abuse packetHandlers[218]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ReportAbusePacketHandler # npc option 1 packetHandlers[155]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.NpcOptionPacketHandler # npc option 2 packetHandlers[17]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.NpcOptionPacketHandler # npc option 3 packetHandlers[21]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.NpcOptionPacketHandler [/code]
Before I start any content updates I want to get all the packets handled. This will be a learning process so I will ask for help. However, I will not copy and paste tutorials.

item.title: Hyperion - Respect the Revolution
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I will be compiling a list of item IDs for herblore. It will all be formatted, tabled, etc. In short, it will look very nice. I plan on doing this for all skills and then sending them to Mendo for MDP 3. Herblore will be the first skill, then thieving, and possibly woodcutting.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion - Respect the Revolution
item.dc:creator: @Daladubz Daladubz
item.description:
@Daladubz wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:14, topic:415917”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=517859.msg3762203#msg3762203 date=1316964617]

The Problem: Hyperion is complicated as fuck.
The Solution: PI

I hope that this turns out well. GL.

If people would take the time to understand the concept of the source, it wouldn’t be a problem. PI use to be use like this, now people can browse through like a breeze.

OT: Good luck with the development, I’m tired of PIs and want them down. I’ll be checking up on this development time after time.
[/quote]

Don’t expect much early. Too busy to get a lot of updates in.

Thanks for the memory leak fix.[/quote]

No problem

[quote=“m1lkman, post:17, topic:415917”][quote author=TheHolyGrail link=topic=517859.msg3762434#msg3762434 date=1316975680]
Kewl sounds nice.

And look at servers like CreativeScape and PJA, shard and hyperion. They both have a crap load of content, and yet very few use them.

Anyways, goodluck.
[/quote]

Hyperion doesn’t have a crap load of content. PJA is incredibly glitchy. Idk why CreativeScape isn’t used more.[/quote]
Also I heard a lot of CreativeScape content was done bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion - Respect the Revolution
item.dc:creator: @Daladubz Daladubz
item.description:
@Daladubz wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:10, topic:415917”][quote author=Daladubz link=topic=517859.msg3762230#msg3762230 date=1316966269]

OT: Graham released the memory leak fix, just incase you didn’t know.

Where?

Holy shit 30 minutes later still sitting here refreshing the page waiting for a response. D:

Important notice to all Hyperion users! There is a memory leak currently present which has not been fixed in any official releases or in the Subversion repository. To fix it, open the EventManager class and after the isRunning() check, add an else which just returns from the function. If you do not fix this, your server will gradually consume more memory and CPU power and some actions may continue forever. (NOTE: this is not related to Sir Harry’s memory problem - one of the first things I did was to ask him to apply this fix which did not help. According to Sir Sean, it isn’t a problem with MINA either - it was something he added - which is kind of what I expected anyway since I had not experienced it during testing Hyperion and the Rune-Server official server.)

Was on the project page on r-s
[/quote]

Oh it fixes memory leaks in Hyperion. Damn. I thought it was for PI.[/quote]
Ohh haha no pi is just to shitty to fix ;D

Anyways good luck with this got my support

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion - Respect the Revolution
item.dc:creator: @pk2play pk2play
item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:10, topic:415917”][quote author=Daladubz link=topic=517859.msg3762230#msg3762230 date=1316966269]

OT: Graham released the memory leak fix, just incase you didn’t know.

Where?

Holy shit 30 minutes later still sitting here refreshing the page waiting for a response. D:

Important notice to all Hyperion users! There is a memory leak currently present which has not been fixed in any official releases or in the Subversion repository. To fix it, open the EventManager class and after the isRunning() check, add an else which just returns from the function. If you do not fix this, your server will gradually consume more memory and CPU power and some actions may continue forever. (NOTE: this is not related to Sir Harry’s memory problem - one of the first things I did was to ask him to apply this fix which did not help. According to Sir Sean, it isn’t a problem with MINA either - it was something he added - which is kind of what I expected anyway since I had not experienced it during testing Hyperion and the Rune-Server official server.)

Was on the project page on r-s
[/quote]

Oh it fixes memory leaks in Hyperion. Damn. I thought it was for PI.[/quote]
Lol. Goodluck milkman full support.

Read full topic

If you do not fix this, your server will gradually consume more memory and CPU power and some actions may continue forever. According to Sir Sean, it isn’t a problem with MINA either - it was something he added - which is kind of what I expected anyway since I had not experienced it during testing Hyperion and the Rune-Server official server.)

Was on the project page on r-s[/quote]

item.title: Hyperion - Respect the Revolution
item.dc:creator: @Daladubz Daladubz
item.description:
@Daladubz wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:4, topic:415917”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=517859.msg3762105#msg3762105 date=1316956714]
OT: Graham released the memory leak fix, just incase you didn’t know.
[/quote]

Where?

Holy shit 30 minutes later still sitting here refreshing the page waiting for a response. D:[/quote]

Important notice to all Hyperion users! There is a memory leak currently present which has not been fixed in any official releases or in the Subversion repository. To fix it, open the EventManager class and after the isRunning() check, add an else which just returns from the function. If you do not fix this, your server will gradually consume more memory and CPU power and some actions may continue forever. (NOTE: this is not related to Sir Harry's memory problem - one of the first things I did was to ask him to apply this fix which did not help. According to Sir Sean, it isn't a problem with MINA either - it was something he added - which is kind of what I expected anyway since I had not experienced it during testing Hyperion and the Rune-Server official server.)

Was on the project page on r-s

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion - Respect the Revolution
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

The Problem: As all of you know, the release of Project Insanity has fueled the use of 500+ items on 317s. I hate this, and I’m sure some of you do too. Before Project Insanity, there was Delta. Delta was a poorly written server as is Project Insanity but many use it. Why? It was POPULAR. There was a server around for a couple years before the source was released. Graham released his base so that more players will use it. The thing is, no one is using it. So how do we get people to start using Hyperion?

The Solution: Someone creates a server with a cool name, (Hyperion), hosts it with loads and loads of content. Obtains a strong player base. It fights to the top. It coasts at the top for a year or longer. The server is released with most of the content. Players stop using PI and go for the next best server. It’s how it works. PI beat out Delta, Delta beat out All-Star.

I have decided to create this project thread because I want to create a server that is incredibly popular. During the next few months however, the server will see little to no work done on it. I have football and school. I can do some stuff on the weekends but not a lot. I am expecting to work on this in early November as that is when football ends and I get in a groove with school.

Currently Working on: Packets/Packet Handlers
Here’s my list. I believe I have most of the necessary packets to start work on skills. I plan on using Graham’s HarvestingAction for most, if not all of the skills.
Once I get a good handle on the method, I’ll be pumping out updates.

# Hyperion configuration file

# world loader
worldLoader: org.hyperion.rs2.GenericWorldLoader

# login server
loginServer: localhost
# world password
nodePassword: ballsack
# world id
nodeId: 1

# packet handlers
#	keep alive
packetHandlers[0]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.QuietPacketHandler
#	region update
packetHandlers[3]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.QuietPacketHandler
#	region loaded
packetHandlers[121]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.RegionUpdatePacketHandler
packetHandlers[210]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.RegionUpdatePacketHandler
#	camera rotation
packetHandlers[86]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.QuietPacketHandler
#	mouse click
packetHandlers[241]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.QuietPacketHandler
#	action button
packetHandlers[185]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ActionButtonPacketHandler
#	walking
packetHandlers[248]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.WalkingPacketHandler
packetHandlers[164]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.WalkingPacketHandler
packetHandlers[98]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.WalkingPacketHandler
#	public chat
packetHandlers[4]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ChatPacketHandler
#	commands
packetHandlers[103]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.CommandPacketHandler
#    wield
packetHandlers[41]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.WieldPacketHandler
#    item option 1
packetHandlers[145]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler
#    item option 2
packetHandlers[117]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler
#    item option 3
packetHandlers[43]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler
#    item option 4
packetHandlers[129]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler
#    item option 5
packetHandlers[135]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler
#    drop item option
packetHandlers[87]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler
#    pickup item option
packetHandlers[236]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler
#    consume item option
packetHandlers[122]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ItemOptionPacketHandler
#    object option 1
packetHandlers[132]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ObjectOptionPacketHandler
#    object option 2
packetHandlers[252]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ObjectOptionPacketHandler
#    object option 3
packetHandlers[70]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ObjectOptionPacketHandler
#    player option 1
packetHandlers[128]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.PlayerOptionPacketHandler
#    magic on player
packetHandlers[249]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.MagicOnPlayerPacketHandler
#    switch items
packetHandlers[214]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.SwitchItemPacketHandler
#    close interface
packetHandlers[130]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.CloseInterfacePacketHandler
#    enter amount
packetHandlers[208]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.EnterAmountPacketHandler
#    report abuse
packetHandlers[218]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.ReportAbusePacketHandler
#    npc option 1
packetHandlers[155]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.NpcOptionPacketHandler
#    npc option 2
packetHandlers[17]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.NpcOptionPacketHandler
#    npc option 3
packetHandlers[21]: org.hyperion.rs2.packet.NpcOptionPacketHandler

Before I start any content updates I want to get all the packets handled. This will be a learning process so I will ask for help. However, I will not copy and paste tutorials.

Read full topic
